metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9622 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Eval injection vulnerability in xdg-utils 1.1.0 RC1, when no supported desktop environment is identified, allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via the URL argument to xdg-open.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdg-utils - 1.1.0~rc1-2ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> beware, original patch causes regression seems to be introduced by: http://cgit.freedesktop.org/xdg/xdg-utils/commit/?id=a616912e48b7ff1d908852739d16525df79471b9 which is after the xdg-utils versions in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: xdg-utils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0~rc1-2ubuntu7.1').
